src:
Zvezdini klinci napravili dobru uvertiru: Totenhem pao na krovu!
06 Nov 2019, 17:50 by Milos
Crvena zvezda U-19 – Totenhem U-19 2:0 (0:0)Radulović 69′, Piplica 90+3′
Na stadionu Voždovca u Zaplenjskoj ulici odigrana je utakmica četvrtog kola Lige šampiona za mlade između Crvene zvezde i Totenhema.
Slavili su beogradski crveno-beli rezultatom 2:0, i napravili dobru uvertiru pred meč ovih klubova u elitnom rangu evropskog klupskog fudbala.
Crvena zvezda: Katić, Mitrović, Blagojević, Matić (od 67. Miletić), Lukić, Milikić, Pantović (od 70. Bačanin), Novaković, Burmaz (od 90. Piplica), Radulović, Babić.
Totenhem: De Bie, Ejoma, Sirken, Bouden, Binks, Volkot, Oukli-Bote (od 78. Poketino), Vajt, Robson (od 67. Vitaker), Benet, Markandej (od 84. Peder).
Nakon početnog ispitivanja snaga, do prve šanse su stigli domaći. Burmaz, koji je debitovao i za seniorski tim, šutirao je tik pored stative sa ivice šesnaesterca u 13. minutu. Zvezda je imala dominaciju u posedu u prvih pola sata igre, a gosti su zapretili preko Vajta, ali mladi veznjak nije bio precizan.
Crveno-beli juniori su najbolju priliku u prvom poluvremenu imali u 39. minutu. Matić je sjajno uposlio Pantovića koji je izbio sam na golmana De Biea, ali je bio neprecizan u završnici. Do kraja pvog dela udarac je okušao i Novaković, koji je šutirao pravo u golmana gostiju sa nekih 18 metara.
Iako je Totenhem uspostavio svoju igru u nastavku, prvi do gola su stigli domaći. Zvezda je povela u 69. minutu pogotkom Andrije Radulovića, koji je dobio duel sa štoperom domaćih i iskosa sa leve strane savladao nemoćnog golmana De Biea.
Do kraja su gosti pokušavali da dođu do izhednačenja, ali je mreža golmana Katića ostala netaknuta. Katić je fantastično intervenisao nakon udarca Beneta u sudijskoj nadoknadi.
Tačku na ovaj susret stavio je Petar Piplica u poslednjim trenucima susreta, rezantnim udarcem nakon asistencije petom Babića.
Zvezda je ostvarila drugi trijumf u Ligi šampiona za mlade i druga je sa sedam bodova, tri više od Totenhema. Izabranici Slavoljuba Đorđevića su se naneki način revanširali vršnjacima iz Londona za poraz od 9:2, ali međusobni skor će odlučivati samo ukoliko dve ekipe imaju isti broj bodova na kraju takmičenja u B grupi.
U narednom kolu, u Beogradu gostuje minhenski Bajern.

POVEZANE OBJAVE
text:
Star kids make good overture: Tottenham fell on the roof!
06 Nov 2019, 16:50 by Milos
Red Star U-19 - Tottenham U-19 2: 0 (0: 0) Radulovic 69 ′, Piplica 90 + 3 ′
The fourth round of the Youth Champions League match between Red Star and Tottenham was played at Vozdovac Stadium on Zaplenic Street.
They celebrated Belgrade red and white with a score of 2: 0, and made a good overture before the match of these clubs in the elite rank of European club football.
Red star: Katic, Mitrovic, Blagojevic, Matic (from 67. Miletic), Lukic, Milikic, Pantovic (from 70. Bacanin), Novakovic, Burmaz (from 90. Piplica), Radulovic, Babic.
Tottenham: De Bie, Ejoma, Sirken, Bouden, Binks, Wolcott, Oakley-Bote (from 78th Poketino), White, Robson (from 67th Whitaker), Bennett, Markandej (from 84th Peder).
After the initial testing of the forces, the first chance came home. Burmaz, who also made his senior team debut, kicked right past the goal post from the edge of the penalty area in the 13th minute. The star dominated possession for the first half hour of the game, with guests threatening over White, but the young midfielder was not precise.
The Red and White juniors had their best chance in the first half in the 39th minute. Matic brilliantly employed Pantovic, who broke out on goalkeeper De Bie himself, but was imprecise in the finish. By the end of the first part, Novakovic also attempted a shot, which shot straight into the keeper's goal from some 18 meters.
Although Tottenham set up their game below, the home side were the first to score. The star took the lead in the 69th minute with a shot from Andrija Radulovic, who got a duel with a stop from the home side, and beat De Bie's powerless keeper from the left.
Until the end, the visitors tried to reach a draw, but the goalie's network of goaltenders remained intact. Katic intervened fantastically after hitting Bennett in the referee's charge.
Petar Piplica put an end to this meeting in the last moments of the match, with a striking blow after assisting the fifth Babic.
The star achieved her second Champions League triumph and is second with seven points, three more than Tottenham. Slavoljub Djordjevic's selectors have somehow retouched their peers from London for a 9-2 defeat, but they will only decide each other if the two teams have the same number of points at the end of the B group competition.
In the next round, Munich will host Bayern Munich.
